body:
@mattfarina (not to add to the conversation, just to repeat what I wrote earlier in list form) my concerns are:

1. A project is limited to a single repository. For example, AOSP has a version number applied to a project spanning a great number of repositories.
- Only one project per repository. A working counterexample is x/tools. Though I'd be happy to see that particular example change to meet the standard, I'm not sure what it will look like and I'm not sure if there are others.
- The unknown unknowns that come from starting with a standard instead of an implementation. (And ideally, multiple implementations using a standard, just as modern web standards are developed.)

These are not major concerns, and I believe 1. and 2. ultimately fall under 3., which may also be worth considering in the context of future Go proposals. (This proposal system is after all, new.)
